newsitem.title: CANADA: Corel sees banner year after strong sales.
newsitem.headline: Corel sees banner year after strong sales.

text.p: Corel Corp said on Wednesday it saw a "banner" year in 1997 after the software company returned to profitability and posted a 102 percent increase in revenues in its fourth quarter.

"Although earnings per share are down for the year as a whole, the strong fourth quarter sales -- an incredible gain from the same quarter in 1995 -- point to a banner year in 1997," Corel chief executive Michael Cowpland said in a statement. Corel reported earnings of US$6.5 million, or a profit of US$0.09 per share against the year ago loss of C$956,000 or a loss of US$0.02 per share.
Some analysts had forecast profit per share as high as US$0.14 per share after Cowpland said recently that WordPerfect sales were better than expected in recent weeks.
Corel, Canada's largest software company, said it planned to increase its market share with Corel WordPerfect Suite 8 and Office Professional, and Corel WordPerfect 7.
Corel said that at the end of the year the company had US$6.9 million in cash.
